security: Disclosing details about Oliver H. CORBUSTON's cover as a member of the Catholic Association for International Peace (CAIP) could compromise his future operations. Sharing such details would reveal ongoing intelligence-gathering methods and potentially expose sources, endangering operations and damaging the CIA's ability to gather information from similar organizations.
summary: A dispatch from the Chief of Base in Washington to DO/I providing information about the Catholic Association for International Peace (CAIP), including literature concerning "Negotiation Now!" and their 40th Annual Conference on "Selective Conscientious Objection in an Age of Conflict."
summary_one_paragraph: This RYBAT/SECRET dispatch, dated October 11, 1967, from the Chief of Base in Washington to DO/I, forwards copies of literature mailed by the Catholic Association for International Peace (CAIP) to its members regarding "Negotiation Now!" and materials concerning CAIP's 40th Annual Conference, scheduled for October 27-29, with the theme "Selective Conscientious Objection in an Age of Conflict." These items were received by Oliver H. CORBUSTON, who had joined the CAIP for cover purposes during a previous assignment.
title: "Peace" Demonstrations
locations_mentioned: Dunbarton College of Holy Cross, 2935 Upton Street N.W.
